1.text: But speak thou the things that become sound doctrine:

2.text: That the aged men be sober, chaste, prudent, sound in faith, in love, in patience.

3.text: The aged women, in like manner, in holy attire, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teaching well:

4.text: That they may teach the young women to be wise, to love their husbands, to love their children,

5.text: To be discreet, chaste, sober, having a care of the house, gentle, obedient to their husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

6.text: Young men, in like manner, exhort that they be sober.

7.text: In all things shew thyself an example of good works, in doctrine, in integrity, in gravity,

8.text: The sound word that can not be blamed: that he, who is on the contrary part, may be afraid, having no evil to say of us.

9.text: Exhort servants to be obedient to their masters, in all things pleasing, not gainsaying:

10.text: Not defrauding, but in all things shewing good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things:

11.text: For the grace of God our Savior hath appeared to all men;

12.text: Instructing us, that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly, and justly, and godly in this world,

13.text: Looking for the blessed hope and coming of the glory of the great God and our Savior Jesus Christ,

14.text: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and might cleanse to himself a people acceptable, a pursuer of good works.

15.text: These things speak, and exhort and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.
